SENT.plain: Transitory global amnesia and migraine without aura are diseases with unclear pathophysiologic mechanisms, but with evidence of comorbidity
We describe twin monozygotic brothers, both presenting episodes of transitory global amnesia occurring only during attacks of migraine without aura
This report supports the hypothesis of a common underlying pathogenetic mechanism, possibly related to the cortical spreading depression
Furthermore, a common genetic trait in both the diseases or more probably in a particular subgroup of patients could be hypothesized
